typeSystemDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.typesystems.health.TNMTypeSystem
typeSystemDescription.description: The type system for the TNM Classification of Malignant Tumours: A cancer staging notation system that describes the stage of a cancer which originates from a solid tumor with alphanumeric codes.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMBasic
typeDescription.description: The basic type of a TNM mention providing a value feature.

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The value of the TNM mention.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMEntity
typeDescription.description: Abstract type for a TNM entity providing a label.

featureDescription.name: label
featureDescription.description: Label of the entity describing the type of the entity, e.g., TUMOUR or GRADING.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMElement
typeDescription.description: Abstract type for a TNM element with modifiers.

featureDescription.name: modifiers
featureDescription.description: The prefix modifiers of the element.

featureDescription.name: postModifier
featureDescription.description: The postfix modifier of the element.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMTumour
typeDescription.description: T: size or direct extent of the primary tumour. Examples: Tx: tumour cannot be evaluated. Tis: carcinoma in situ. T0: no signs of tumour. T1, T2, T3, T4: size and/or extension of the primary tumour.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMNode
typeDescription.description: N: degree of spread to regional lymph nodes. Examples: Nx: lymph nodes cannot be evaluated. N0: tumor cells absent from regional lymph nodes. N1: regional lymph node metastasis present; (at some sites: tumor spread to closest or small number of regional lymph nodes). N2: tumor spread to an extent between N1 and N3 (N2 is not used at all sites). N3: tumor spread to more distant or numerous regional lymph nodes (N3 is not used at all sites).

featureDescription.name: lymphNodes
featureDescription.description: The attacked and tested lymph nodes.

featureDescription.name: lymphNodesSentinel
featureDescription.description: The attacked and tested sentinel lymph nodes.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMMetastasis
typeDescription.description: M: presence of distant metastasis. Mx: metastasis cannot be evaluated. M0: no distant metastasis. M1: metastasis to distant organs (beyond regional lymph nodes).

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMModifier
typeDescription.description: A modifier of a TNM element

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMPostModifier
typeDescription.description: Postmodifier of an element: a, b, c. Among others subclassification of tumour size, e.g. T1a: tumour under 0.1cm

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMGrading
de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMGradingChar
de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMLocation
typeDescription.description: Further specification of the metastasis: Pulmonary (PUL), Bone marrow (MAR), Osseous (OSS), Pleura (PLE), Hepatic (HEP), Peritoneum (PER), Brain (BRA), Adrenals (ADR), Lymph nodes (LYM), Skin (SKI), Others (OTH)

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMRClass
typeDescription.description: Residual Tumour (R) Classification. Rx: Presence of residual tumour cannot be assessed. R0: No residual tumour. R1: Microscopic residual tumour. R2: Macroscopic residual tumour

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMCertainty
typeDescription.description: The C-factor, or certainty factor, reflects the validity of classification according to the diagnostic methods employed. Its use is optional. The C-factor definitions are: C1: Evidence from standard diagnostic means (e.g., inspection, palpation, and standard radiography, intraluminal endoscopy for tumours of certain organs). C2: Evidence obtained by special diagnostic means (e.g., radiographic imaging in special projections, tomography, computerized tomography [CT], ultrasonography, lymphography, angiography, scintigraphy, magnetic resonance imaging [MRI], endoscopy, biopsy, and cytology). C3: Evidence from surgical exploration, including biopsy and cytology. C4: Evidence of the extent of disease following definitive surgery and pathological examination of the resected specimen. C5: Evidence from autopsy

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMAdditional
typeDescription.description: Additional TNM mentions

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMNotation
typeDescription.description: The aggregating annotation for TNM annotations.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.AbstractTNMLymphNodes
typeDescription.description: Abstract type for lymph node mentions.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMLymphNodes
typeDescription.description: Information about the attacked and tested lymph nodes.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMLymphNodesSentinel
typeDescription.description: Information about the attacked and tested sentinel lymph nodes.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMLymphaticInvasion
typeDescription.description: Information about the lymphatic invasion.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMVascularInvasion
typeDescription.description: Information about the vascular invasion.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMPerineuralInvasion
typeDescription.description: Information about the perineural invasion.

typeDescription.name: de.averbis.textanalysis.types.health.TNMDocumentClassification
typeDescription.description: The TNM classification result for a document.
